subject.normal: Trunk (mozilla-central) is now open again for regular checkins

headers.subject: Trunk (mozilla-central) is now open again for regular checkins
headers.received: from h-135.office.mozilla.org (corp-241.mountainview.mozilla.com [63.245.220.241]) by mail.mozilla.com (Postfix) with ESMTP id 3ABB221003D; Thu, 29 Jan 2009 10:22:40 -0800 (PST)

body.para:
All P1 blockers for Beta 3 other than those in the JS component have now landed on trunk, and the JS team uses their own set of Tinderboxes on the TraceMonkey tree, so we're re-opening trunk (mozilla-central) for usual checkins. The rules are on Tinderbox and
http://wiki.mozilla.org/TreeStatus :

Please (please!) run tests locally on your machines before checking in. The reason we'd closed the tree was the number of test failures had been making it hard to land things, and doing what you can to reduce that time cost on the entire development community would be appreciated.
As always, head over to #developers or reply to dev-planning if you have questions.
